channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Island Nations Can Build Back Stronger After Hurricane Melissa
item.description: Hurricane Melissa exposed the urgent need for island nations to rebuild stronger through resilient infrastructure, nature-based defenses, transparency...

item.title: AI Chips For The Future
item.description: AI transformation depends on specialized chip innovation—power, cooling, cost, and design speed drive the next hardware era.

item.title: ‘NYT Mini’ Clues And Answers For Saturday, November 1
item.description: Looking for help with today's NYT Mini Crossword puzzle? Here are some hints and answers for the puzzle.

item.title: Government Seeks Private Backers To Deploy AI To Protect Electric Grid
item.description: Government researchers are seeking to commercialize a unique use of AI to detect cyber attacks and physical problems with the electrical grid.

item.title: ‘No Holding’ Law In Arizona Curbs Calls, But Not Texts And Other Uses
item.description: After a ban on holding a cellphone while driving was passed in Arizona, handheld conversations decreased 26%, but drivers didn’t stop scrolling, swipi...

item.title: ‘AI is way beyond the hype phase’: Experts warn businesses must reskill for the new reality
item.description: Companies must not only develop existing talent but also rethink the skills they are sourcing.

item.title: Government shutdown blocks key GDP data release – what do the Fed's models say about economic growth?

item.title: Some Americans will hand out food to trick-or-treaters this Halloween as SNAP benefits are about to end

item.title: Largest US airlines raise pressure on Dems to 'pass a clean CR' and end shutdown
item.description: Major U.S. airlines are calling on Congress to reopen the government as TSA workers and air traffic controllers are continuing to work without pay.

item.title: Research monkeys got loose after a truck overturned on a highway. Their owner, destination, and exact purpose remain shrouded in mystery
item.description: The Mississippi crash is one of at least three major monkey escapes in the U.S. over the past four years.

item.title: Judges order Trump administration to use emergency reserves for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: The administration said it wasn’t allowed to use a contingency fund of about $5 billion for the food-aid program.

item.title: Crypto’s big ‘Uptober’ ends with a whimper, Bitcoin down 4%
item.description: While October didn’t bring in big wins for Bitcoin, one analyst says there’s reason to be optimistic for the cryptocurrency’s growth.

item.title: BlackRock's Larry Fink says US still top destination for global investors to park money

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
